name: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Tsim Sha Tsui

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent Christmas in Hong Kong. This hotel is in a great shopping district with easy access to the easy-to-use Hong Kong subway system. It's also an easy walk to the Star Ferry Pier. So it is really ideally located in Kowloon with quick access to Hong Kong island.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel.

reviews.text: Our basic room was anything but; spacious with a comfortable bed and large bathroom and an nice view of the city even from just the 10th floor. Breakfast was included and the buffet had great food and selection.
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel

reviews.text: Nice pool out on a terrace with a great view of the skyline.
reviews.title: Excellent location, hotel, and service

reviews.text: Other than breakfast the restaurants are too expensive, even for Hong Kong (which is not cheap). But the adjoining mall and nearby neighborhood had lots of good local choices.
reviews.title: Book with confidence

reviews.text: Very good value for the money in an expensive city.
reviews.title: Good location, excellent service

reviews.text: Our company recently held a seminar for our asia distributors in Hyatt Regency TST. Seldom have I experienced such a service level; management and staff did their utmost to make our event a success. Having 25 years experience I know how to appreciate.
reviews.title: Great for business events, prime location..

reviews.text: Besides, rooms are clean and well equipped. In our package Internet was included; it worked very well. Our guests were happy and very satisfied.
reviews.title: Five star service at a three star price.

reviews.text: Breakfast is very good, nice choice, excellent coffee and fresh juices. We had several buffet lunches in the cafe.Selection is rich and the buffet highly recommendable.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: The location is great, close to MRT and shopping, walking distance to the ferries.
reviews.title: Spent 3 Weeks at Hyatt TST

reviews.text: Hong Kong has many famous hotels, many of which seem to be trading on reputation rather than service. I recognize that we're not the ideal customer: one adult and one child coming off a long plane ride, but every contact with staff showed that they genuinely wanted to provide the best possible service.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice in Hong Kong if you like TST / Nathan Road Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel met all of our expectations except one. Sometimes after a day of sightseeing and finally arriving back to our hotel we like to "chill out" in the lobby & people watch before going up to our room. There are no chairs in the lobby only benches. I suppose that is the management's choice to keep the lobby free of people. With that in mind, that would not prevent us from revisiting this property. The buffet breakfast is plentiful, the guest rooms are modern & spacious. We were very happy with the location too.
reviews.title: Very Modern Hotel in a good location

reviews.text: Probably Hyatt's best hotel in HK. Was my first stay but stayed at the Grand in Wan Chai before and this felt better. Room spacious and modern with good quality furniture and fittings, extensive outdoor pool area (biggest outdoor pool is TST I reckon...) and Hugo's restaurant had fantastic service even though I found the set-lunch a little uninspiring. One more thing worth mentioning is that it's quite complicated to get into! The hotel lobby is on 4th floor which means either finding the right entrance or walking through the mall. Nevertheless this is become more common in hotels so need to be used to it but could be better marked.
reviews.title: Probably better than the Grand...

reviews.text: the harbour view room is excellent and good location
reviews.title: nice harbour view

reviews.text: Cheaper in comparison to Grand Hyatt properties but everything i need is already here. I dont have anything to ask for, Fast Internet Access, Replenishment of towels 2 x a day. Provides turn down service. Great breakfast, Great Bed.
reviews.title: Amazing Location, Amazing Rooms and Amazing rates

reviews.text: Location so amazing cross the street and you got mtr station, go to basement and you got taxi to go anywhere in HK and Go to Nathan Road and shop till you drop, Oh My God!!!
reviews.title: HYATT REGENCY HONG KONG TSIM SHA TSUI FIRST CLASS

reviews.text: This hotel is relatively new and it shows. The hotel is modern and tastfully decorated and is housed above a shopping mall and below residential apartments all in the one tower. I had an executive room with a king bed. I believe this meant that I had both a bath and a shower (separate) and perhaps a few square metres more than a standard room. The bed is firm yet comfortable. The bathroom is spacious and has a nice assortment of toiletries. The room has great block-out curtains to ensure a sleep in and very effective air conditioning. The gym is obvisouly housed in what used to me a couple of rooms. It has a great assortment of new machines and space to do some floor exercises. There is an outdoor heated pool with a wonderful deck area. I ate dinner in Hugo's Restuarant (which was exceptional) had a drink in the bar (Chin Chin's) which has an excellent ambience and live band later at night and had breakfast which offered a nice buffet and eggs cooked to order. Above all the service was terrific. For example, when I went doen for dinner I was advised that the group I was meeting had gone down to the bar for a pre-dinner drink. Rather than point me in the direction, the staff member walked to to the elevator ans escorted me all the way to the entrance of the bar. I will definitely stay here for my next trip to HK.
reviews.title: An Excellent Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hyatt Regency in Hong Kong was wonderful. Everything is five stars- location is close to the train and walking distance to Ave of the Stars. Services was impeccable and kind. The room was beautiful- modern, large, quiet, calm. I particularly enjoyed sitting on the window seat each morning, drinking coffee and looking out over the city. It is an oasis. No complaints, highly recommend.
reviews.title: My favorite Hyatt I've stayed in.

reviews.text: Our Stay at the Hyatt Regency Tsim Sha Tsui was excellent. We had room service from the Hyatt and most cost HK$75 and was just super fantastic. We had waffles to Dim Sum Combination to pancakes. If you have a Hyatt Gold Passport, you have a free cup of coffee or tea served with milk etc. The food at the Chinese Restaurant was good, we had lobster, abalones, it was just too good. However you must pay for the internet. Service was good, it was convenient as it was situated next to the Tsim Sha Tsui and East Tsim Sha Tsui for easy access. It was great.
reviews.title: My Stay at Hyatt Regency Hong Kong Tsim Sha Tsui

reviews.text: I stayed here on two separate occasions in one week during my visit to Hong Kong. The first was for a seminar my company sponsored for a group of international customers and the second was one night I stayed after coming back from Macau. Here are my thoughts:
reviews.title: Would stay again

reviews.text: Good:
reviews.title: Just returned from HKG and Regency Stay

aka: Hyatt Regency Hong Kong Tsim Sha Tsui Hotel Hong Kong
description: Situated in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui business and tourist district with direct access to the MTR subway stations, Hyatt Regency Hong Kong, Tsim Sha Tsui offers 381 guestrooms and suites, state-of-the-art meeting and banquet facilities including a pillarless ballroom accommodating up to 400 persons and 5 meeting rooms with various sizes, authentic cuisines with 3 restaurants and a bar, as well as a well equipped fitness centre.
